body:
>>>>> "Stuart" == Stuart Wier writes: 
 
 Stuart> "headless=true" is not a help since the program 
 Stuart> needs to run just as if it had graphics. 
 
I don't understand this explanation. I generate large image files all 
the time using java.awt.headless=true. My graphics code can't tell the 
difference whether it's running on real AWT or headless AWT, it works 
fine either way. I didn't have to do anything special for this to work. 
Are you sure it matters to your code? 
 
Just checking... 
 
-- 
Seth Tisue @ Northwestern University | http://tisue.net 
lead developer, NetLogo: http://ccl.northwestern.edu/netlogo/

subject: Re: Java graphicsgeneration on Mac servers without graphics   hardware
